dialogues.text: SIRENS wail from all directions as Griffin slinks down another alley. He comes upon a beat-up old Lincoln. He picks up a metal trashcan and smashes out a window. Campbell rounds the corner, way down the block, in time to see the lights come on and hear the car start. He picks up his pace, sprinting as fast as he can. Halfway down the alley, he misses a step and slips to one knee. He holds his heart and shakes his left arm. He struggles to shake it off and pick back up the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln eases onto a nearby street, but within seconds several cops cars are on his ass. Campbell runs out of the alley, still chasing him on foot and almost gets hit by a police cruiser. He slams his fist on the hood and signals the startled COP to get out of his car. Campbell holds up his badge.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Special Agent Campbell. I head the FBI/Chicago PD task force which means I rank you which means I'm taking your car. Griffin punches the accelerator, rounds a corner and comes face to face with a road block which he simply BLASTS through, sending wooden saw-horses and COPS flying. A moment later, Campbell races through the same intersection. Griffin speeds another block before coming up on stopped traffic at a red light, Campbell closing in behind him. Griffin jumps a median and passes the stopped cars in the oncoming lanes. He races across the busy intersection and almost makes it through but gets clipped by a pick-up truck and loses control, jumping the sidewalk and SMASHING through a glass and plastic bus-stop before side-swiping a row of three gas pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three mushrooms of gas spray out of the ground showering Griffin's Lincoln and drenching the parking lot. Griffin sits, calmly waiting as cop cars converge from every direction. Campbell gets out of his car and draws his weapon. Several Cops do the same. He waits. More and more cops pull up. He calmly shifts the car in gear and tosses a Zippo lighter out the window. The entire area explodes.  A block away, Griffin races down the side street and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerial shot of the wreckage. The gas station still burns. Charred cop cars. Dozens of other cops parked here and there. Ambulances. The shot tracks two blocks revealing other car accidents and the abandoned building which is still swarming with cops. The shot lowers and closes in on a seventh-story window. Closer and closer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN or so COPS and FEDS work the crime scene. Campbell crouches next to Jessica's bloody body, her face etched with death. He looks into her eyes for a long moment then lowers his head in a gesture that suggests a very deep surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell's apartment looks worse than usual. It's dark dusty and it looks as if it has been ransacked. He is nowhere to be seen, but Ibby's voice can be heard through the door.

dialogues.speaker: IBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Campbell!? You okay? Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ibby and Mitch stand in the hallway outside Campbell's apartment. Ibby bangs on the door loudly. He gives up and turns to Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: IBBY
dialogues.text: Open it. Mitch pulls a small electronic device from his pocket and kneels in front of the door. The device looks something  like a handheld screwdriver with a modified tip. Mitch inserts the tip into the keyhole and WHIRS the machine to life. There's a short RATTLE before the knob turns and Ibby pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ibby and Mitch enter the dank apartment, concerned by its appearance. Ibby opens the bedroom door and sees Campbell's legs hanging out of the bathroom floor. He and Mitch rush over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ibby leans over Campbell and tries to rouse him. He is pale white and the bathroom is a mess. Ibby checks his pulse.

dialogues.speaker: IBBY
dialogues.text: (to Mitch) Jesus, he's freezing cold. Call a paramedic! But just then Campbell rouses awake. Campbell presses his hand to his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (wheezing) Ibby, a paramedic shows up at this apartment I swear to you I will shoot them. He shakes Ibby's arm loose from his clothes and sits up against the bathroom counter. Campbell tries to stand but immediately slumps back to one knee, gasping for breath. His eyes go wide with confusion and pain.

dialogues.speaker: IBBY
dialogues.text: (to Mitch) Call them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell lies in bed, semi-conscious. Ibby and a DOCTOR hover over him. The doctor holds a small rubber toy in the shape of a martian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood pressure got too great for one of the veins in your heart and it collapsed. Sounds worse than it is. It'll bea minor procedure called an angio- plasty. We'll stick a small balloon through a scope and into the collapsed vein and BOOP! We open it back up. She squeezes the toy causing it's martian head to triple in size and its eyes and ears to pop out cartoonishly.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (to Mitch) It’s out of the question. I'll have to put it off.

dialogues.speaker: IBBY
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. Your heart muscle isn't getting the oxygen it needs. The tissue is dying. I want to go into the O.R. r ight now. Two, three days here, another week of rest and then you can start back easy, a few hours a day. Look, I have a daughter at University of Chicago. I want to get you back in shape as much as anyone. (squeezes the toy again) Trust me. Campbell closes his eyes, overwhelmed by a sense of futility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the police district office, a crowd of BYSTANDERS, REPORTERS, and PHOTOGRAPHERS makeshift police barricade between the door van. A moment later four COPS exit the building, Norton who wears an orange prison jumpsuit. of hundreds crowd a and a police escorting  COPS work the barricade trying to hold everyone back as they all surge forward to get a look or ask a question. Hollis takes in the scene with disgust. POP! POP! POP! Suddenly everyone hits the ground and scatters as three shots are fired from close range. Norton slumps to the ground bleeding from two bullet wounds. One cop has also been hit. The rest of the cops draw their weapons on an OLDER MAN in light blue Sansa-belt slacks and a golf shirt who stands holding a small-caliber revolver. The COPS wrestle him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norton lays on a stretcher next to an ambulance. The area is chaotic. One PARAMEDIC pumps his chest; another PARAMEDIC has an oxygen mask over his mouth. Hollis hovers next to the paramedics, cringing at his terrible state. After a few seconds, Norton stirs and cries out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: (to her co-worker) He’s conscious! (to Hollis) Talk to him! Try to keep him alert!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Me? Shit I don't know what to say!

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Just talk to him! Say the alphabet! Anything!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: (frazzled) Hey! Norton! Hang in there, man. We're going to the hospital right now! You're looking good.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: His blood pressure's dropping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my fault!

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: I wasn't talking to you!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. (back to Norton, as if to a child) What else, what else? Let's see... I had a retarded cousin once. Bet you didn't know that, did you? He died though. The paramedics work faster to try to save him but Hollis senses that it's over and stops talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell watches a special report on the local news broadcast from outside the station.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: The gunman is reported to be Padgett Weaver, the recent murder victim's sixty-six year- old father who had just arrived in Chicago. When asked why he didn't trust the justice system to do its job, Mr. Weaver said simply, "I am an old man and I don't have time for that crap." Campbell sighs and tosses his hands in the air at this. Just then, Polly enters the room tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (pleased to see her) You didn't have to come here.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Something tells me you wouldn't have come to me.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (pointing at the TV) D'you see they shot my witness? It's like someone's making up new ways to be ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should get your nerves all bound up in a knot about it. (clicks off the TV) I can't believe they let you watch that thing.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: How else am I going to know what's going on? Ibby's got everyone on a vow of silence.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: When's the last time you ate? Are you allowed to eat anything besides the shit they serve here?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Probably not but let's order something anyway.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: How's Thai? My favorite joint is just around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch, Diana, and SEVERAL FORENSIC TECHS, stand under a dirty LATE MODEL SEDAN that has been lifted on a mechanic's lift. All of the doors are wide open. The back window has been shot out, and the front fender and grill are damaged. The car appears to be the one Hollis and Campbell chased a few nights ago.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC TECH
dialogues.text: We found two of the slugs imbedded in the frame.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No other physical evidence?

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC TECH
dialogues.text: Not yet, but give a guy a break. This thing was in the river three hours ago. Just then, Campbell's secretary comes into the room holding an 8' X 10' envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Agent Casper? This came for Agent Campbell and I thought you-

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How'd it get here!?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL'S SECRETARY
dialogues.text: (clueless) It just came in the regular mail. Mitch snatches the envelope from her hands and waves at Diana.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (heading out of the room) Let's do it. Get Mackie on the phone. Get a copy to him. I'm going to get with Ibby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Hollis addresses a battery of reporters.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Good morning and thanks for your attention. My comments today will be brief. As most of you know, we have received another photograph. The bank of REPORTERS all BLURT questions at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell sits in bed, looking totally wrecked. He watches Hollis finish his address on TV.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: (calming the reporters) No, no, no. I'm not answering questions today. I'm only here to pass on the photograph and request that you continue to help us in this investigation. That is all. Campbell sits with no noticeable expression of emotion o his face. He seems truly defeated.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Police Detective Hollis Mackie informing us that this terrible game will continue today. Here is a photograph of the killer's latest target. Campbell suddenly reacts strongly to the television. He half stands up, almost stumbling out of bed. He pulls the IV from his arm, still not taking his eyes off the TV. We still can't see what he sees, though his reaction makes us wish we could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis races along talking to Mitch on the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Mitch Casper.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: It's Mackie. I'm looking for Campbell. He's not at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Yeah, they just called to inform us of that very fact. Nobody knows where he is.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Maybe he's at home? I'1l drop by there.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: There's really no way to tell, is there? He hangs up the phone and wheels the car around the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis screeches to a halt outside of Campbell's apartment, leaving his car double-parked. He runs up to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis bangs loudly on Campbell's door.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Hey! Open the Goddamn door! Hey! Campbell? You okay?! He sighs, steps away from the door and kicks it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis enters Campbell's stuffy, messy apartment.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Jesus, man. You gotta get a maid. Campbell?! Hollis quickly searches the kitchen (small and visible from the living room) and the bedroom (he opens the door and can tell it's empty). Hollis tries one last door. It's locked. He knocks loudly.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Campbell? He tries the door again, jiggling the knob very hard. It doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) This is becoming a habit. WHACK! He kicks the door in. The room appears to be a walk-in closet. Inside, cardboard boxes are stacked from floor to ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis steps inside the room, curiously. He opens a box and pulls out some file-folders - crime scene photos, reports, etc. Griffin's name is everywhere. These are obviously Campbell's personal files on Griffin. Hollis notices several burned down candles. He turns around and sees a thin white sheet covering one wall of the closet.  He lifts the sheet and tries to peer under. A look of confusion washes over his face. He yanks the sheet from the wall, sending tacks flying. The sheet drops down to reveal the enormous photographic collage we saw in the opening credits. Its true scope and detail are revealed for the first time. It spans the entire wall and looks as if it were methodically, obsessively pasted together.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: (awe-struck) What the fuck? He reaches into his jacket pocket and pulls out a folded white piece of paper. He unfolds the paper and looks at it: It is a flier with a photo of the next victim. He holds it close to the collage to reveal that it is THE WOMAN IN THE COLLAGE.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Campbell, what is this? His eyes dart around the collage. He reads the newspaper clippings: INQUIRY CLEARS AGENT OF NEGLIGENCE. He sees Campbell's name in all of the articles. Griffin's name is in several as well. The name 'Lisa Alexander' is also everywhere. The birthday card reads "Love, Lisa". He scans quickly trying to make sense of what he's seeing.

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE.
dialogues.text: Hollis glances at something that clicks. It's a photograph of a cemetery. A closer shot of a headstone shows the engraving to be 'Lisa Alexander. 1964-1999'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis steps out of the closet and toward the front door. On the TV there is a picture of Lisa Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: CNN REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...at this time police have not located the young woman who they have reason to believe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell drives through light traffic. He rounds a corner and we see the CEMETERY from the photograph through the windshield. Campbell pulls into the deserted parking lot and steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis runs down the front stairs. He hops in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell walks through the graveyard, unhurried but deliberate. He rounds a corner and stops short. Griffin sits on the grave we saw Campbell leaning against earlier. Campbell draws his gun and walks slowly over. Griffin notices him.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Hey Campbell! How's your heart, pal? Here have a beer, it'll make it feel better. Here. Griffin tosses him a beer but Campbell side-steps it, letting drop to the ground. He loads a shell into the chamber of his 9mm, still trying to make sense of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me something, Campbell. Did you move two thousand miles to live near this woman's grave? Griffin takes a drink out of his beer. Campbell tightens his grip on the pistol. He takes dead aim at Griffin's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, isn't it? Man, you gotta get out more. I mean is this a satisfying relationship? (picks a flower and plucks pedals) She loves me... She's decomposing... She loves me... she's decomposing.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (lowering the gun) Why don't we talk about what we're doing here. Is this it? You here to give yourself up?

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Why didn't you ever tell anyone you laying pipe with her? Just cause she was married?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (losing patience) We don't seem to be communicating. Let me be clear with you, I have no problem with shooting you dead where you sit.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Well you do have one problem. Griffin tosses his beer and fishes a business card out of his pocket. Campbell quickly raises his gun. Griffin doesn't even flinch. Careful to keep his gun trained on Griffin, Campbell reaches and takes the card. It reads: Polly Beilman, Ph.D. It is badly stained with blood. Campbell winces.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I'm dead, your friend Polly plans to meet a rather gruesome fate involving candlelight and quite a large pool of kerosene. Campbell looks at him for a long moment, weighing his options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something about attractive women burning alive, don't you? Tell me, what was it like? Could you smell her flesh burning? Campbell flicks Polly's business card toward Griffin, it flutters away and lands in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: You've already killed her.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: C'mon. You know me better than that. That's not even her blood.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Take me to see her then.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know about that. Let's just sit here and talk for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: We'll talk once I see her. I have to know if there's anything to talk about. Griffin looks at him for a long beat. Campbell lowers his gun, takes a breath and hands it to Griffin who is surprised by the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, take it. I trust you. I just need to see that she's all right and then we'll talk. Griffin shrugs and takes the gun.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Fine. Let's go. They turn and take a few steps. Blam! Griffin shoots the ground, startling Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow. It's loaded.  Campbell relaxes and they take a few more steps. BLAM! Griffin laughs. BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis races dangerously through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell drives, seething with anger; Griffin sets Campbell's gun on the seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: You look older since you were in LA. You look more and more like your father. Campbell turns to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Relax, I never hurt him. I just used to go visit him in the home. Towards the end, he couldn't tell the difference between us so I just told him I was you. It made him happy, that you were there.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Griffin. What do you want? I want you to think about what you need. I can try to get you that and we can make an exchange. Anything that you need for Ms. Beilman's safety.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: You're all I need, Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffin's car cruises along on the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis' car is parked in the deserted lot. He stands nearby searching a directory of the cemetery plots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis stands over Lisa Alexander's grave. Griffin's picnic beer bottles are still strewn about. He struggles to make sense of the scene. His first clear clue comes when he comes across a cartridge from Campbell's gun. He searches the area some more and finds Polly's bloody business card. He still has no real idea of what went on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, even though his driving puts him right on the edge of death, Hollis talks calmly on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: See what you can find out about Polly Beilman. She's a shrink. Her office is at 2414 Eastern Avenue. Send a car by to check it out. I'm there in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffin's car eases off the freeway and into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell drives.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: (sincere) You're not angry with me, are you, Campbell? You don't think I'm an evil person, do you?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (taken aback by his tone) I'm not much in a position to be a judge right now, but, I think words like evil are just words people use to keep from having to think. You are who you are. You do what your driven to do. That's the way it makes sense to me.  Griffin takes Campbell's hand with both of his and squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Thanks, Campbell. You're a good friend. You're like a brother to me. Did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Did you have any real brothers or si-

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Oh, Campbell, what the fuck?! I'm trying to have a real conversation and you're psycho analyzing me! Are you Polly now?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (turns away) You brought it up. I think it was a perfectly valid-

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Look at me when I talk to you! (Campbell does) You're trying to control this situation! Can't you leave your job out of this?! Just this once! I'm telling you Campbell, you've been seeing that bitch Polly too- Campbell takes a quick glimpse at the road to orient the car.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said look at me when I'm talking! Campbell turns back, totally ignoring the road even though they're in traffic and the road is winding.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I'm listening. What? What do you have to say? I'm listening. Go ahead!  They stay, eyes locked, as the car travels forty miles per hour down the road. After a long moment, Griffin cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I forgot what I was going to say. Campbell turns and looks back at the road but it's too late, the car has faded into the curb. Campbell wrenches the wheel as the car crunches up onto the curb. Griffin and Campbell both bounce around the front seat until Campbell gets the vehicle back under control.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looking over his shoulder ) That was fun. Campbell uses the distraction to slip his cell phone out of his pants pocket and push 'redial.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis screeches to a stop outside of Polly's office building. Two other cruisers are already parked out front, lights flashing. He jumps out of his car and approaches Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: She's missing. Secretary's upstairs dead.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Fuck. What about her house?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Empty. Your people are there already. Hollis’ cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Hello? For a moment it sounds as if the line is dead but then Griffin's voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew if I just came here and talked to you, in person, you'd understand me better, Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: (covering up the phone) Fuck. He's got Campbell. Let's get a trace on it, now! Mitch flips open his own cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COMPUTER TECH stands in front of a wall-sized map of the city wearing a headset, talking to Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER TECH
dialogues.text: (staring impatiently at the map) Give me a second; give me a second; give me a second, okay, okay. He's about twenty miles north of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch and Hollis stand outside both on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You gotta do better than that!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER TECH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No shit. Give me another minute and we'll have has exact location.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on Hollis' phone) Communication is important to us. I realized after you left L.A. that you were the only thing I had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell drives Griffin's car down a small street that runs along the waterfront.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: You were the only one who thought about me. You were my audience. And for a long time, I was the only one you had. And then you met Lisa, which... (he points toa parking lot) Pull in here. Campbell pulls in. The parking lot is in front of a five story brick and glass building that sits on the river front. Water laps against the bricks on one side of the building. The area is completely deserted. As Campbell steps out of the car, he lets the cell phone fall into the floorboard. Griffin doesn't notice it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell and Griffin step into an old steel-grated freight elevator. Griffin holds his gun casually trained on Campbell. He pushes a button labeled 'Five' and the elevator begins to ascend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Computer Tech still stands in front of the map.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER TECH
dialogues.text: (suddenly elated) I got him! I got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell walks reluctantly alongside Griffin down a corridor in the warehouse. They reach a door and Griffin unlocks it and kneels down, carefully slipping his hand inside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffin's fingers slide up the inside of the door and unhook a string that runs through two pulleys before attaching to the trigger of a small "riot" shotgun which was set to go off if the door were opened. Griffin pushes Campbell inside. The warehouse/loft is about the size of a small basketball court with polished concrete floors, high ceilings, and floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river. Polly sits gagged and bound to a chair in the center of the room. The wooden chair sits in a two-inch deep pool of kerosene. The only light in the room comes from the windows and several foot-tall dinner candles which stand in the Kerosene pool. Campbell has just long enough to take in the scene before Griffin WHACKS him over the head with a heavy metal rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerial shot of Hollis' car swerving through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ibby's in an F.B.I. van that screams through the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three helicopters sit, blades already angrily chopping the air. Dozens of other AGENTS and PILOTS run here and there. After a moment, Ibby's F.B.I. van arrives and screeches to a halt. Ibby jumps out and runs toward one of the helicopters. Before he's even belted in, Hollis’ sedan roars around a corner and races toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell (younger, clean-shaven) walks up to the front porch of the house, careful not to be seen or heard.  He peers under the blinds into a window. Through the thick leaded glass his POV is distorted. He sees a figure move in the living room. Campbell pulls away and looks through another window, trying to get a better idea of what's happening. From the second window he can see a woman bound and gagged. His breath quickens. He stands and kicks the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell bursts into the front room. He hears a loud commotion in the next-room and rounds the corner just in time to see a man duck into a back hallway, dumping a card table over in his haste. Campbell gets a shot off but it thumps harmlessly into the wall. Campbell turns his attention to LISA ALEXANDER who sits bound and gagged in a chair - and we realize that she is the same woman in the fire and this is the room that was on fire. He runs quickly to her and rips the tape off her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? Paralyzed with fear, she only manages to shake her head. The back door slams loudly, capturing Campbell's attention.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're going to be all right. Everything's going to be fine. Campbell turns to run after the man, failing to notice that two burning candles (which had been on the card table) have rolled across the room and ignited a small fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell bursts through the back door and flies down the stairs and into the alley. His POV: far ahead a figure races through the shadows.  He runs down the alley, leaving the house further and further behind. After another few seconds, he hears a sharp CLAPPING sound. He wheels around to see the smoke rising up from inside the house he was just in. He sprints back toward the house and up the staircase. He kicks in the back door, ducking away from the rush of flames and heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman SCREAMS. Campbell pushes further into the crumbling hallway, dodging burning debris that falls around him. She SCREAMS again, a long piercing howl and-

dialogues.speaker: -CAMPBELL WAKES UP INT. WAREHOUSE, LIVE/WORK LOFT
dialogues.text: As Campbell regains consciousness it is clear that he's disoriented and in great pain from a migraine. The room is blurry. Cuban Dance MUSIC plays loudly. Griffin dances lightly around the room. Polly whimpers in fear. The music fades down and Griffin slows his dance moves slightly.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: (to Polly) I don't know how you can just sit there with music like this. Such a waste. Campbell puts one hand to his head, shielding his eyes, and with the other, grasps at his inside pocket, looking for his syringes. Griffin has removed the tape from Polly's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who-hoo? Campbell looks up and sees Griffin holding Campbell's leather medicine pouch in one hand and his gun in the other. Griffin walks over and picks him up by his jacket and sits him in a wooden chair (outside the perimeter of the kerosene pool). Campbell is too disoriented to resist. On a nearby table, Griffin clicks on a bright Halogen desk lamp and pushes right into Campbell's face. He  flinches from the light. Griffin flips the light away from Campbell and then back, away and then back, repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That hurts, doesn't it? They say flashing lights and migraines just don't go together at all. Griffin's bullying has a older-brotherish quality to it.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (still flashing the light) Quick! Name three candy bars and I'll stop. Quick! Three candy bars! Quick! Griffin loses interest and tosses the lamp back onto the table. He quickly draws his gun and points it Campbell's head.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, Campbell. I'm not going to kill you. We need each other. We define each other. We are yin and yang. Black and white. Isn't that right Polly? Polly grows more anxious, unsure whether to answer. Campbell's head throbs insanely and his vision is still distorted and hazy.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder ) I said, isn't that right, Polly!?

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: (very tentative) I'm sorry, I don't understand the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you or did you not reach the conclusion that Campbell and I need each other in order to have meaning in our lives.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Yes. I did, though, you have... I think so. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The low moon illuminates the rolling hills. There's a moment of stillness, and then from behind a hill appears a WHIRRING mass of rotor blades. The three F.B.I. helicopters sweep low across the fields outside of Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving low and fast over a desolate expanse of highway... the faint glow of city lights in the distance. Behind the COMMAND PILOT we see Ibby and the OTHERS gazing soberly toward their destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen police vehicles scream through the streets of Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell still squints against the light. White splotches cloud his vision. He watches as Griffin lightly caresses Polly's cheek and then neck.... He stands and takes several steps toward Griffin.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Take your fucking hands off her.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Sit down.  Campbell takes a few more steps toward him. Griffin puts the gun to Polly's head. She cringes.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: You can talk all you want. I'll listen but I'm not going to let you touch. Put the gun. We both know you're not going to do it.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Why do we know that?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Because you only get to kill her once and that way won't be any fun. BLAM! Griffin shoots Campbell in the shin, sending him end-over-end from the force of the impact.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three F.B.I. helicopters BOOM past the camera and continue on, sweeping low across the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffin stands over Campbell who writhes in agony on the floor. An enormous pool of blood is forming under him. Both of his hands grip his shin. Griffin picks him up and sets him in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Get up. Get up! How's this for Deja Vu, Campbell? We got the fire. We got the pretty girl that you've put in our way. Only last time the plan backfired. Instead of bringing us closer, it pulled us apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? That I made a rookie mistake and let my obsession with you affect - Griffin grabs his hair and looks him right in the eye, the other hand cocked back with the gun pointing at his head.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: NO! NO! NO! That's not what I want you to say! THE OBSESSION IS ALL YOU HAVE! The HATRED is all you have! Love is fleeting. Hate lasts forever. The mistake was turning back in the alley. What I want you to say is thank you! Thank you for coming here and saving your life!

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I don't know what the voices tell you, Griffin, but I'm not same as you. You don't define me. I'm not your thing. You're a job to me. You're paperwork. Griffin pushes his head back and steps away. He walks over to nearby table and picks up a length of piano wire attached to two small wooden blocks.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Please don't do this to me.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I have to do this. He's not going to understand anything else. You heard him. Paperwork. Campbell tries to watch what's happening but can barely see from the blinding headache. He sees Griffin nearing Polly, unfurling the wire in front of him. He drapes the wire in front of her and slides it up her chest. She whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Thank you. Griffin stops and cocks his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I said thank you. I mean it. You made your point. Griffin walks over to him and leans an ear toward him sarcastically, again affecting the big brother.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (whispers) I said thank you. Griffin leans in closer and Campbell suddenly jabs the blade of his pocketknife under Griffin's chin, just missing the jugular. Griffin gasps and staggers backward, stumbling and falling into the kerosene. His gun clatters across the cement floor. Campbell stands awkwardly and pounces onto Griffin, jamming his thumbs viciously toward his bloody throat. Kerosene splashes dangerously close to the burning candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A S.W.A.T. COMMANDER motions for his men to clear the way as the three F.B.I. helicopters rise over the rooftop's ledge and land in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffin's about to fall unconscious as Campbell bares down on his throat. Rings of kerosene lap against the base of the candles, causing them to teeter back and forth. Griffin suddenly lands a solid blow to Campbell's temple, knocking him aside. Again, kerosene splashes dangerously around as they vie for position, exchanging what punches they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police vans screech to a lurching halt and cops in riot gear pour out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell and Griffin are locked together, limbs entangled. Campbell loses his footing and Griffin slams him down face first into the concrete. Their bodies smack down six inches from one of the candles. Griffin pushes Campbell's face into the kerosene. Campbell sputters and coughs as he fights to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small army pours into the building through every ground floor entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A metal door crashes open as waves of S.W.A.T. officers storm the darkened basement. As they advance, their red- laser sights trace a maze of pipes through the cavernous basement.

dialogues.speaker: S.W.A.T. OFFICER
dialogues.text: (into his headset) Basement's clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ibby, Hollis, and Mitch (now dressed in riot gear) approach the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffin still has Campbell's face half-submerged. Campbell's POV: The shotgun sits fifteen feet away. Campbell surges upward, rolling Griffin off of his back. Campbell scurries across the floor and snatches up the shotgun. He spins around and takes a bead on Griffin --  who stands calmly in the middle of the kerosene pool, holding his bloody neck with one hand and one of the burning candles in the other. If Campbell shoots him, he'll drop the candle into the Kerosene.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: (panting, smiling) Oh boy, what are we going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A team of S.W.A.T. officers thunder up the metal fire stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another S.W.A.T. team kicks open a door to a loft, scaring the hell out of COUPLE watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECOND S.W.A.T. Officer hustles three terrified PEOPLE down a dark hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND S.W.A.T. OFFICER
dialogues.text: Let's go! Let's go! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ibby, Mitch, and Hollis enter the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell, gun still trained on Griffin, slowly paces the perimeter of the kerosene pool. Griffin makes his way toward his own gun which lies in the pool a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Why don't you go ahead and set that gun down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it! (resolved) He's going to kill me anyway. Shoot this piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Put the gun down. The gun wobbles in Campbell's hand. His breath races.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.W.A.T. Officers race down the fourth floor hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stand off continues.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: He can't do it. He'd be killing you and held never be able to live with that. Griffin kneels and picks up his pistol. He holds it in one hand and the candle in the other. He aims the pistol at Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put it down.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Shoot him! He'll kill me anyway! Campbell starts to lower the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: CRASH! The door bursts open under the force of a battering ram. S.W.A.T. officers surge into the room. Griffin wheels around and shoots at the S.W.A.T. Team. Campbell raises the shotgun and takes aim. BOOM!  SUPER SLOW MOTION as Griffin's hand and much of his forearm disintegrate. The impact snuffs out the lit candle, half of which flies through the air harmlessly. Griffin wheels back around, taking aim at Campbell. BOOM! His chest opens up as Campbell shoots him again. Griffin's face grows slack with death as his body hurls through the air. Campbell's eyes focus on the remaining lit candles. He drops the shotgun and before Griffin even lands, Campbell begins running toward Polly, his feet splashing heavily through the kerosene, his bad leg hindering his progress. As Griffin's back THUMPS flatly in the pool, Campbell watches a wave of kerosene radiate out from under his body. The wave rolls away from him and toward the other candles. Campbell reaches Polly and without breaking stride, scoops her up (chair and all). The wave of kerosene reaches the candles, all of which fall at approximately the same time. As the flames hit, a bright ring of fire SPRINGS UP and races in from the perimeter of the pool, closing in on Campbell. An instant before the wall of flame overtakes him, he SMASHES through the outer window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops and agents wheel around when they hear glass shatter and watch as Campbell and Polly soar through the air and SPLASH into the river, flames roaring out behind them. UNDERWATER CAMERA - picks up Campbell and Polly as they thump into the freezing river. Blood from Campbell's leg plums in the water. He immediately swims toward Polly who sinks like a brick. He grabs her and heads to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis, Ibby, and Mitch rush towards the room. They push their way past the other cops and look in.  The room is ablaze and filled with smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell and Polly both come up gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: (spitting water) Yeah Yeah. I'm okay. AGGHHHH! - Polly and Campbell look up and cower as Griffin, completely ablaze, leaps from the window and plunges into the water right beside them. UNDERWATER CAMERA - as Griffin breaks the surface and the flames are immediately snuffed out. Back on the surface, Campbell and Polly desperately scan the water around them, waiting for him to resurface. On the bank, several COPS have pulled their weapons, also waiting for him to resurface. For a long moment, there is no sign of him. Campbell tries to swim toward the bank. TWO COPS dive in and help. They take Polly from him just as Campbell sees Griffin's body bob to the surface nearby, motionless. The cops fish Polly out of the water, but Campbell can't help but make sure Griffin is really dead. He swims a few feet toward the body, which is still face down. Campbell reaches tentatively for Griffin's shoulder and rolls him over revealing that his face has been horribly burned beyond recognition and that he is in fact, dead. Campbell's voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like I said, it's never that easy. The best we can do is hope he fucks up and do what we can to be there when he does. Campbell turns and swims toward the bank.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's been six months, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly and Campbell step out of the elevator. She carries her briefcase. He carries a bag of groceries.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: What's your point? They reach her door and she unlocks three dead-bolts.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: I'm just saying you still seem a little paranoid. Maybe you should see someone about this. She opens the door and they step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step inside and are greeted by an enormous Rottweiler. Campbell pats its big head roughly.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: (playfully annoyed) I am not paranoid. She says as she disarms the security system.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: No definitely not. Campbell walks through the rest of the apartment, turning on all the lights and checking all the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Okay, so I have a few issues with personal security. But I think that's pretty understandable, given the circumstances, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: (calling from down the hall) Definitely. He walks back into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all clear. Once again. She walks him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: It's the least I can do, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly closes the door behind Campbell and he grins as she bolts about fifteen different locks and chains. He walks to the elevator and pushes the down button and waits. After a moment he hears the bolts and chains again. The door opens and Polly steps into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Actually, I thought of something else you can do for me.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: What's that? The elevator door pings open.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Have dinner with me. I hate eating alone.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPBELL
dialogues.text: Me too. He starts to walk toward her. They go back inside and the bolts and chains start banging and clicking again.
